turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Right...she married...what was he?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He buys and sells the world.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Peter Webber!  Right.  Quite the spotlight on that guy.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I did tell you, didn't I?  That I'd be ready to start the Berlin model today?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Well, that's sort of...you're sure you're not hungry?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: This isn't me.  We can show clients endless options, change anything in a matter of hours on the computer.  But you won't change.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Typing and clicking myself to renderings isn't why I started building models.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: All of us are typing and clicking, George.  Whether we want to, or not.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Which is why we bid out a quarter of our projects.  It doesn't make a lot of sense anymore to want what we don't have and don't want what we do.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've been here twenty years.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Maybe that's too long.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Maybe...?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: That's too long.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: How old are you?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Forty.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We were probably in school together.  You went to Berkley?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Class of eighty-six!  I didn't know you were there.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I was a sophomore when I got the call my parents were dead.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Listen...maybe I can get you a year.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I hate this job.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: What are you talking about?  You love your job.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: From the day I started...to today.  Can't stand it.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Then it sounds like I'm doing you a favor.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It may sound that way, but I react out of fear.  My life has nothing to do with what I like or don't like.  You haven't been listening, have you?

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: I didn't know there would be a quiz, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: For everything.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Well, I feel better about this now.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Good.  I was hoping for that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I've got one favor to ask.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: What can I do for you, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I built my first model here when I was twenty.  There are hundreds of them on shelves around the office.  Twenty years of my life.  I was wondering if I might be able to pick a few to keep, to take home?  Only the ones that really mean something to me.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Oh, well...those are...I mean, we don't get to keep our work.  I could maybe ask them if you could choose one.  But, you know, frankly George, you were the best. Computer models can't begin to match the beauty you gave yours.  They're a part of this firm.  They inspire me.  I go out there and sometimes just stare at something I've designed.  It amazes me. I would miss that too much.  Look, I may be going out on a limb, but you go out there and look them over, every single one of them and pick the one you like the best and take it with you. Just run it by me first, just in case, you know...but I'm sure it'll be okay.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BRYAN
turns.text: Well, it's the least I can do.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes, it is.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Is Alyssa home?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: She's out with a friend.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh...do you know when she'll be home?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: She didn't really say.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh...okay.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I didn't recognize you!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Alyssa said you don't even have plumbing over there.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Not a shower.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks for the shower.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I want you both to stay.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Come over anytime you need to, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thanks, I'd like that.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: If she's not up, you can use my shower.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: You're here early today.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We're getting out of the ground today.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Is Alyssa here?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: It's midnight.  What's the matter, Sam?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Nothing.  My dad's dying.  I really need to talk to Alyssa.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: This has got to stop!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He escaped.  He's going back in.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Does it give you some sort of perverse pleasure to expose your...penis in plain view of my sixteen year-old daughter?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: There are no windows facing my...exposure.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: George, this is the third time.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The plumber's due out on Friday.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: You'll have to explain that to the police.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You were the only neighbor I could tolerate.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: I did warn you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My life is a warning.  I just can't figure out for what.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I forgot where I put my keys.

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: And you thought they might be under her dress?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: COLLEEN
turns.text: Where are you?  You're driving me crazy, waiting like this.  I want you in me now!

turns.speaker: COREY
turns.text: The whole summer, man.  Party in Tahoe.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: COREY
turns.text: It'll just be my brother the dweeb on weekends.  All we gotta do is sand and paint the cabin, dude.  My dad's gonna let me use the boat and my charm is gonna let me use my rod.  Income village is the place to hook up with hump.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'll ask.

turns.speaker: COREY
turns.text: Hey, it beats letting town folk go down on you for the summer.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I never said anything.  I haven't done anything.

turns.speaker: COREY
turns.text: I know what the deal is.  Josh is a pimp. I'm not stupid.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You don't know what the deal is.  There is no fucking deal.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Your mom and the boys can drop by anytime.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: To check up on me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll be around to check up on you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why would you be there?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Because I live there.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You live in Cory's parents' cabin?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Did you tell him he's spending the summer with me?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No I'm not!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Who are you, anyway?  I don't even know you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'll know me by the time we're through.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not going!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll get your bag.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mom, tell him I'm not going.  You already promised me!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You have everything?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not going!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You don't have a choice.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Mom...please.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Your nose ring comes out of your nose. If you've got them in your nipples, they come out, too.  And there's no make-up at my house.  No glue sniffing.  Huffing. No pills, no grass.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: If you hit me, I'll call the police.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You've worn out your welcome at this house, Sam.  I won't ever hit you.  This may well be the worst three months of your life, but you've earned it.  So, pick up your suitcase and go get in the truck.  Now.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'll hate you forever.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You can't even begins to know how much I hate my father.  Think of it as a family tradition.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Are you totally insane?!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I almost saw Catalina.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Probably in the bible.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What are you doing?!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I warned you yesterday.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't touch me!  You can't touch me!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Do you ever get like the slightest inkling that you might want to help me instead of doing absolutely nothing?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Get the inkling, Sam.  I'm getting tired of your attitude.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I hate turkey.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No you don't.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I want you to take out your nose ring and leave it out.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It bugs me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You snore at night.  That bugs me.  Can I take you out?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Your brothers are right.  It was the most god-awful smell I've ever had my nose around.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm gonna take a walk.  I need some money.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'll have money when you work.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're so predictable.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No one would blame me if I left!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'd blame you.  I want you here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not doing it!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It'll be fine.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why don't you just beg some money off my dad and move into something decent with a real kitchen and a real bathroom?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'd rather sell my nuts to a castrati.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't beg.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And I don't take a shower in the middle of the yard.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can promise you complete privacy.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You can't promise me anything!  You don't have anything to promise!  You live in a garage!  You don't have cable!  You're not hooked up to the internet because you don't even own a computer!  You don't have a job!

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: If you had a stupid phone or I could use your truck, mom would give me some money.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You'll have money when you work for it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey...hey!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: When are you going to be back?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Well, until you know, you can't go.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, okay.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A friend of yours is here.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Did you got through my pants?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I might have a solution.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I've been using since I was twelve! You're all so unbelievably stupid.  You didn't give a shit about anything I did until now!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll apologize for everything but today...Today I give a shit.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're too fucking late.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The gloves on the table are for you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You can't make me do a thing.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Sit down for a second.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Oh, so you're in the big shit now!  Child abuse.  People go to prison for what you just did to me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: My dad used to play a game.  I never really understood what it was until after he was gone.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I was holding for someone.  That wasn't even mine.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The game was to make me smaller than he was.  No matter what.  He could be almost invisible as a human being, but I had to be smaller.  So if I got good grades, I was a pussy for not playing football.  If I cut my hair for him, it wasn't short enough.  If I shaved it, I looked like a psycho.  I never won the game.  Not once. And if he couldn't make me smaller with words...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'll have to pay him back.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I won't ever hit you.  I don't want you smaller.  I want you to be happy.  You're not.  Not here with me. Not home with your mother.  Not up in Tahoe.  Not alone.  Not anywhere.  You're what I was most of my life, Sam. I see it in your eyes.  In your sleep. In your answer to everything.  You're barely alive.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm not even listening.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You know that great thing, though?  Is that change can be so constant you don't even feel the difference until there is one.  It can be so slow that you don't even notice that your life is better or worse, until it is.  Or it can just blow you away.  Make you something different in an instant.  It happened to me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Twenty years of hating what you live in...what you are.  This is the end of it, Sam.  I'm gonna build something of me here that I can be proud to give to you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't.  I don't want it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Do whatever you want with it.  I don't care.  All I want from you is for you to remember we built this house together.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: We haven't build shit.  You're just tearing down your father.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Try it.  It feels good.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hi, Alyssa.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hi, Mom.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I took some of your Vicodin.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I know.  Why?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I like how it feels not to feel.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I know the feeling.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: How do you become something you're not?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What would you like to be?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What I'm not.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What are you now?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's not true.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: See, that's the thing...I am what I say I am.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I know parts of who you are.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What do you know about me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: When you started first grade and your mom went to work, it was so she could save for an apartment.  But then she met Peter and skipped the idea of renting.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He's got nothing to do with me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I couldn't imagine how I could compete with him for any part of you.  So, I didn't.  He wanted you to have his last name...I let him even take that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: He was a prick when I was six, and he's a prick today.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I wish you had told me then.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'm telling you now.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I gave up on you.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I'd be in Tahoe having fun if you had given up.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What would you be doing now?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Getting high, I guess.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: If I asked you to stop, would you?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I haven't used anything for two days. I'm trying.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm proud of you, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Don't be.  And hide whatever that new drug is you have.  I like it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Are you talking?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I was just thinking about my mom.  She wouldn't leave him.  I remember one time she made us dinner wearing sunglasses.  I mean it was dark outside and in.  But we never talked about it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Sun glasses?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: To hide a black eye.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Why wouldn't she leave?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I think she was terrified of living with him...but maybe even more terrified of life without him.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I would have killed him.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Everything would have been better if you had.  You'd have liked your grandmother. And there'd be a girl out there that'd have her mother.  I remember reading about her in the paper.  They couldn't find her father and her mother was dead. I still feel guilty about that.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Do you ever wish you had done it?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I loved him too much.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: After everything he did to you and your mom?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: After everything.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: That's so weird...

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Dale wants to know if we should run an outside outlet for Christmas lights with a switch inside?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Absolutely.  Have him put it on a separate line.  At Christmas, we'll pact it so full of lights, we'll make God wear sunglasses.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You look better than ever.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't think Mom cares that much that my...that Peter left.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She seemed upset.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What's wrong with your back?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I mean, do you need to have surgery on it or what?  Because those pills you're taking are for a lot of pain.  And you're going through them quick.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Are you taking them still?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: No, but I count them.  In a sock isn't new, you know?

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know what that means.  What kind of problem?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The kind where there isn't really an answer.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I still don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I wanted you here so we could have a few months together.  Maybe everything happens for a reason.  Something bad to force something good.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I don't know what that means.  What kind of problem?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The kind where there isn't really an answer.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I still don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I wanted you here so we could have a few months together.  Maybe everything happens for a reason.  Something bad to force something good.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: And you told Mom today?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We're all dying from the start.  I just got picked for Advanced Placement.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You lied to me!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I would have lied to me if I thought I'd believe it.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: This was all for your sake, wasn't it? Having me here?  Trying to get me to like you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I never tried to get you to like me.  I tried to get you to love me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Well, congratulations!  You fucking pulled it off!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't wanna go, Sam.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I'd eat a lot of red meat.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Good for you.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: What would you do?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'd build a house.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: What kind of house?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You know what mortise and tenon is?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: No one's really said four months is all you have, have they?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Stage four pancreatic cancer.  They haven't even pretended to offer treatment.  You tell me, when would you start eating red meat?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Can you build a house in four months?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can die trying.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Good for you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I haven't been touched in years.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't know what that was.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A handshake, or you know, someone pats you on your back through clothes. Doctors, people who have to touch you. But not by people who want to.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: No.  A friend... your mother?  Everybody gets touched by someone they love.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Isn't that weird?  I mean, I dated a little bit after my divorce, for four or five years.  Six years.  I know when my son was younger...maybe when he was ten or eleven even, he'd run up and wrap his arms around me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I aimed high.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: We just weren't very much alike, I guess. I don't know.  I liked your dad more than I liked you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Was bankrupt and dead before I was twenty.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Left you this place.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It was in my name so he wouldn't lose it. He stole it from everyone that deserved it by putting me on title.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Do you know what I'd give to have this! Forget how I got it!  I can't afford dirt in this town.  I live in Riverside, Goddammitt  And you get to piss in the ocean.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Your kid was down around Diver's Cover again, smoking pot.  I didn't write him up...told him I wouldn't tell you...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Thanks for telling me.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: At least your father tried, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Ah!  Oh....

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: I know there's an explanation.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Mr. Dokos called to complain that you and a boy are squatting illegally in the garage of your house.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Check the permits.  It was built as a guesthouse.  It's a legally rentable unit grandfathered when South Laguna was incorporated.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: I'm surprised he hasn't left.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I haven't forced him to work.  I only wet him down once.  Why would he leave?

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: It's my day off.  I thought I'd help with the plumbing.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I need you to do me a favor.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: God, you look like crap, George.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I want you to find someone for me.

turns.speaker: KURT
turns.text: Why do you let your dog crap on his lawn, day after day?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't let him.  He just loves to.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: How many bedrooms will your house have?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Three.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: I just wanted to know where Mom was?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh.  Sorry.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She needs to be alone, I think.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: Because Dad left?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She's a little sad, is all.

turns.speaker: RYAN
turns.text: I don't even care if he ever comes back.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You should lock your doors.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Ring the bell before you try the door.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Did Sam call to tell you he wouldn't be over this weekend?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You let him pierce his nose?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Lock the door behind you.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Where is he?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Where he always is.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He doesn't answer.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: He never answers.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why does he have a lock on his door?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Because he put the lock on!  Do you think I told him he could have a nose ring?! Why do you ask me everything you should ask him!?  I don't know anything, anymore!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I called everyone, everywhere!  You just vanished!  You could be dead!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Thanks for waking me up.  Picking me up. You're loud today.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You're inconsiderate and absolutely devoid of emotion!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You're the most beautiful woman I have ever known in my life.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm not talking just physically.  Even your anger is perfect.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I didn't think you'd know I went missing.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You didn't think someone from your office would call and tell me you wrecked the entire building and threatened people with a baseball bat?!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A blueprint spool.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Where have you been for a week?!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Four days.  I left to think.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What did you do with your dog?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Kurt's been feeding him.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: But you can't call me while you think?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I wasn't thinking.  Look, I'm sorry I didn't think to call you while I thought...I think.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Why would they tow your truck?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I was parked in day parking.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Why call me?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm going to tear down the shack and build my house.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You've been saying that for twenty years. While we were dating, you said it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: There's nothing anymore to stop me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Money?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Severance pay.  And I'm going to cash in my life insurance policy.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: How many years did I live with your beams and boards?  First in the garage, then in the living room.  We're going to do it, Robin.  Next year.  Next year.  Salvaged floorboards from a house in Pasadena. Doors from a church in New Hampshire...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I love those doors.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Where will you live?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The garage.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Look, I wasn't serious about you taking Sam, so you don't have to get into any actual construction to get out of it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: When's school over?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Friday...God, I hate the thought of him home all day.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'll be by Saturday to pick him up.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: He doesn't want to spend the weekends with you anymore.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Not for the weekend.  For the summer.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You and Sam are going to live in a garage without plumbing for the summer?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The garage is plumbed.  I'll put in a toilet.  We'll survive.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Thank you for at least sounding sincere.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Sounding?  I need help.  He's cheap labor.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: One of you would end up dead.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: At least we'll have a house to show for it.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Forget it, really.  I'll survive.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I want him with me.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: No, you don't.  Trust me.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, hey!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm married.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What was I supposed to do?  When you didn't show up Saturday, I tried to call. Your phone isn't working.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't have a phone.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I drove over and you were gone.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I can't leave the house?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Last time you were gone for a week!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Did you tell him he was spending the summer with me?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: No.  I was going to let you do that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He's not spending the summer in Tahoe.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I did say he could go.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: George --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He's not spending the entire summer with another kid in Tahoe.  If he leaves, I will follow him up there and I will drag him home by his nose ring.  He can hate me.  You can hate me.  He can try to kill me while I sleep.  You can call the police.  You can call your husband or your attorney, but Sam is spending the summer with me.  He's my son.  He's sixteen.  That's it.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We're fine.  Turkey sandwiches.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Well, for later then.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It makes me sad.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I used to live here.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: But you hated four out of the five you did.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I was here six years.  And I only hated two.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Which?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: The first and the last.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't even like turkey sandwiches. What kind of pizza?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Sam's favorite.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I was up on the roof this morning, tearing it down and it struck me as strong as anything ever has.  That I'm happy today.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: What have you been before today?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It was just that, maybe the way the sun struck the ocean, the sound of the waves. It was simple, whatever it was.  Then I started thinking about the last time I felt this good.  It's been a long time.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: Do you remember?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: The only time I can think of for sure, I was holding onto Sam in the ocean, saving him from the waves.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You head was pressed against my chest.  I could feel your heart racing.  And I remember I kissed your hair.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: We have it on video!  Was that when?  My parents were down for his sixth birthday! I remember that.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I'm fine.  Nothing.  I'll drop by your lunch tomorrow.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's not breakfast yet.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I dreamed about your house last night.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Finished or unfinished?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: It was perfect, George.  Amazing.  It was so real.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Didn't you once dream you could lick people well, though?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: That wasn't a dream.  That was Sam.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh...with his ear infection!

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: My tongue around the edge of his ear is what cured him.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Go in there and lick his attitude.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: The antibiotics weren't working.  It's what I believe, George.

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: I've been wrong a lot in my life.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hindsight.  It's like foresight without a future.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: With your hands or your tongue?

turns.speaker: ROBIN
turns.text: You're not well.
